qas.question: When did a Mali conflict begin?
What group were the Mali radicals affiliated with?
When did France provide troops in Mali?
What did France call its Mali operation?

answers.text: dislodging the al-Qaeda affiliated groups from northern Mali

qas.question: Where did a conflict begin in January 2013?

context: The conflict in northern <b5_0>Mali<b5_0/> began in <a0_0>January 2012<a0_0/> with radical Islamists (affiliated to <a1_0>al-Qaeda<a1_0/>) advancing into northern Mali. The <b6_0>Malian government<b6_0/> had a hard time maintaining <b12_0>full control over their country<b12_0/>. The fledgling government requested support from <b13_0>the international community<b13_0/> on combating the Islamic militants. In <a2_0>January 2013<a2_0/>, <b7_0><b9_0>France<b9_0/><b7_0/> intervened on behalf of the Malian government's request and deployed troops into the region. They launched <a3_0><b10_0>Operation Serval<b10_0/><a3_0/> on <b8_0><b11_0>11 January 2013<b11_0/><b8_0/>, with the hopes of <a4_0>dislodging the al-Qaeda affiliated groups from northern Mali<a4_0/>.
